newsitem.title: UK: Egypt plans $1.0 bln bond to retire debt - newspaper.
newsitem.headline: Egypt plans $1.0 bln bond to retire debt - newspaper.

text.p: Egypt plans to launch $1.0 billion of sovereign bonds next month to retire a large proportion of its short-term commercial bank debt, the Financial Times newspaper said on Monday.
Quoting Egypt's finance minister Moheiddin Elghareeb, it said a quarter of the bonds would be denominated in dollars and the rest in Egyptian pounds.
Proceeds from the bonds, which will have maturities of between three and five years, will be used to retire debt in Egyptian pounds, the newspaper said.
It said the dollar bonds would carry Egypt's sovereign credit rating of BBB- by Standard and Poor's and Ba2 by Moody's Investors Service.
